summary.para: Stores a boolean value that can be transferred to/from Lua.
Instances of this class are immutable.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.CompareTo(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if this object is less than, greater than, or equal to the given boolean value.
member.param: The boolean value to be compared with.

returns.para: Returns a positive value if this object is greater than the given object. (True is greater than false.)
Returns a negative value if this object is less than the given object. (False is less than true.)
Returns zero if the both objects are equal.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this object is less than, greater than, or equal to the given object.
member.param: The object to be compared with.

returns.para: Returns a positive value if this object is greater than the given object.
Returns a negative value if this object is less than the given object.
Returns zero if the both objects are equal.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.Equals(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines if the given value matches this boxed object's stored value.
member.param: The value to compare with.
member.returns: Returns true if the given value matches this boxed object's value. Returns false if not.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this object matches the given object.
member.param: The object to compare with.

returns.para: Returns true if the given object's value matches this object's value.
Returns false if they do not equal, if given null, or if the given object is of a different type.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.False
member.summary: Pre-allocated instance of this class set to "false".

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.From(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fetches a pre-allocated instance of this class based on the given value.
member.param: The boolean value to be boxed.
member.returns: Returns a True or False instance of this class.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets an integer hash code for this object.
member.returns: Returns this object's hash code.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.PushToLua(System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes this object's data to the top of the Lua stack.
member.param: Memory address to a lua_State object, convertible to a C/C++ pointer.

returns.para: Returns true if the push was successful.
Returns false if it failed or if given a memory address of zero (aka: null pointer).

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.ToString
member.summary: Gets the boxed boolean value in string form.
member.returns: Returns "true" or "false".

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.True
member.summary: Pre-allocated instance of this class set to "true".

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedBoolean.Value
member.summary: Gets the boxed boolean value.

summary.para: Provides an easy means of converting Lua data to a Corona boxed data object.
You cannot create instances of this class. You can only use this class' static methods.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedData.FromLua(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a boxed data object containing a copy of the value(s) indexed in Lua.
member.param: Memory address to a lua_State object, convertible to a C/C++ pointer.
Index to a Lua object in the Lua stack such as a boolean, number, string, or table.

returns.para: Returns a boxed data object containing a copy of the indexed Lua object's data.
Returns null if unable to copy the indexed data in Lua or if given invalid arguments.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable
member.summary: Stores a dictionary of key/value pairs that can be transferred to/from Lua as a table.

member.summary: Creates an empty table.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.Clear
member.summary: Removes all entries from the table. This makes the table count zero.

member.summary: Determines if the given key exists in the table.
member.param: Unique key to search for in the table.

returns.para: Returns true if the given key was found in the table.
Returns false if the key was not found or if the given key was null.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the collection.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.First
member.summary: Gets an iterator used to iterate through all of the key/value pairs in the table in a foreach loop.
member.returns: Returns an iterator to be used by a foreach loop.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.GetValueByKey(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedComparableData)
member.summary: Fetches a value from the table by its unique key.
member.param: Unique key to search for.

returns.para: Returns the value belonging to the given key.
Returns null if the key was not found in the table or the given key was null.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.PushToLua(System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes this object's data to the top of the Lua stack.
member.param: Memory address to a lua_State object, convertible to a C/C++ pointer.

returns.para: Returns true if the push was successful.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaBoxedTable.RemoveByKey(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedComparableData)
member.summary: Removes an entry from the table by its unique key.
member.param: Unique key to search for in the table.

returns.para: Returns true if the key's entry was successfully removed from the table.
Returns false if the key was not found in the table or if the given key was null.

summary.para: Adds the given key/value pair to the table.
If the given key already exists in the table, then its value will be replaced.

param.name: key
param.para: Unique key to store the value under in the table.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

param.name: value
param.para: The value to store in the table. to the property in the collection.
Setting this to null will remove its entry from the table. This matches Lua's behavior where Lua tables do not support nil values.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventArgs
member.summary: Provides a generic collection of all property values belonging to a Corona event dispatched to/from Lua.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventArgs.#ctor(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties)
member.summary: Creates a new object providing a Corona event's properties to be dispatched to/from Lua.

param.name: properties
param.para: Collection of name/value property pairs that make up the Corona event table in Lua.
This collection must contain a "name" property having a unique Corona event name or else an InvalidArgumentException will be thrown.
The given argument cannot be null or else a NullReferenceException will be thrown.

summary.para: Gets the event's unique name from its properties collection such as "system", "timer", "enterFrame", etc.
In Lua, this is the name provided via the "event.name" field in the Lua listener function.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventArgs.Properties
member.summary: Gets a read-only collection of name/value property pairs making up the Corona event.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventHandler

summary.para: Delegate to be invoked by the Corona runtime when an event has been dispatched from Lua.
An instance of this handler is expected to be given to the CoronaRuntimeEnvironment::AddEventListener() method in order to subscribe to a particular Corona event.

member.param: Reference to the Corona runtime that raised/dispatched the event.
Provides the Corona event's properties.

returns.para: Returns a value back to Lua, if applicable to the event.
Can return a , , , , or .
Returning null will return nil in Lua.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties
member.summary: Stores a collection of name/value property pairs for one Corona event that is intended to be dispatched to/from Lua.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Clear
member.summary: Removes all properties from the collection, making the collection empty.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the given property name exists in the collection.
member.param: The unique name of the property to search for.

returns.para: Returns true if the given property name exists in the collection.
Returns false if not or if given a null/emptry string.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Count
member.summary: Fetches the number of properties stored in the collection.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.CreateWithName(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new Corona event properties table using the given event name.

param.name: eventName
param.para: The Corona event "name" to be added to the event properties table.
Expected to be one of the Corona event names defined here: http://docs.coronalabs.com/api/event/index.html
Alternatively, you can use your own custom event name that you can use to communicate between native code and Lua, such as how it works with Corona plugins.
This name is required. You cannot dispatch an event to Corona without a name.
Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

member.returns: Returns a new properties collection assigned the given event name.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.First
member.summary: Gets an iterator that can be used to traverse all properties in the collection via a foreach loop.
member.returns: Returns an iterator that can be used to traverse all properties in the collection.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches a property value from the collection by its property name.
member.param: The unique name of the property to fetch from.

returns.para: Returns the value of the specified property as a boxed object.
Returns null if the property name was not found.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a property from the collection by its unique name.
member.param: The unique name of the property to remove from the collection.

returns.para: Returns true if the specified property was removed from the collection.
Returns false if the given property name was not found or if given a null/empty string.

summary.para: Adds the given property name/value pair to the collection.
If the given property name already exists in the collection, then its value will be replaced.

param.name: name
param.para: Unique name of the property to add or update.
Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

param.name: value
param.para: The value to be assigned to the property in the collection.
Setting this to null will remove the property from the collection. This is because Lua tables do not support nil values.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Set(System.String,System.Boolean)

summary.para: Adds the given property name/value pair to the collection.
If the given property name already exists in the collection, then its value will be replaced.

param.name: name
param.para: Unique name of the property to add or update.
Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

member.param: The value to be assigned to the property.

summary.para: Adds the given property name/value pair to the collection.
If the given property name already exists in the collection, then its value will be replaced.

param.name: name
param.para: Unique name of the property to add or update.
Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

member.param: The value to be assigned to the property.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Set(System.String,System.Int32)

summary.para: Adds the given property name/value pair to the collection.

param.name: name

Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

member.param: The value to be assigned to the property.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties.Set(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: Adds the given property name/value pair to the collection.
If the given property name already exists in the collection, then its value will be replaced.

param.name: name
param.para: Unique name of the property to add or update.
Cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

member.param: The string to be assigned to the property.

summary.para: Runtime used to run a Corona project and manage its lifetime via its suspend, resume, and terminate methods and events.
You would not normally create a CoronaRuntime instance yourself. Instead, you would use a Corona runtime object provided by a "CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.Phone.CoronaPanel" Xaml control.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntime.#ctor(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.Interop.CoronaInteropSettings)
member.summary: Creates a new Corona runtime with the given interop settings.

param.name: settings
param.para: Provides cross-platform and cross-language feature implementations to the C/C++ side of Corona.
Also provides an optional reference to the Corona control that the runtime will be rendering to.
All other settings in the given object must be set or else an exception will be thrown

summary.para: Raised after loading the "config.lua" file and just but before executing the "main.lua" file.
This is the application's opportunity to register custom APIs into Lua.
Resumes the runtime, if currently suspended.
This will raise an "applicationResume" system event in Lua.

member.name: E:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntime.Resumed
member.summary: Raised when the Corona runtime has been resumed after a suspend.

summary.para: Starts executing the "resource.car" or "main.lua" file found under the default resource directory specified by the property.
If the runtime is currently executing a Corona project, then it will be terminated before running a new one.

returns.para: Returns a success result if the Corona runtime was able to start up.
Returns a failure result if unable to start. In this case, the result object's "Message" property will provide an error message indicating why the failure occurred.

summary.para: Starts the Corona runtime by executing the given *.lua or *.car file.
If the runtime is currently executing a Corona project, then it will be terminated before running a new one.

param.name: filePath
param.para: Absolute path to a *.lua or *.car file to be executed.
This is normally set to a "main.lua" or "resource.car" file in the resource directory.
This file does not have to reside in the resource directory, but it is recommended since the Lua require() function defaults to finding Lua files in the resource directory.
Cannot be null or empty string or else an exception will be thrown.

returns.para: Returns a success result if the Corona runtime was able to start up.
Returns a failure result if unable to start. In this case, the result object's "Message" property will provide an error message indicating why the failure occurred.

summary.para: Starts the Corona runtime by using the given path as the resource directory and executing the "resource.car" or "main.lua" file found it it.
If the runtime is currently executing a Corona project, then it will be terminated before running a new one.

param.name: resourceDirectoryPath
param.para: Absolute path to the directory that Corona should use as the resource directory.
Cannot be null or empty string or else an exception will be thrown.

returns.para: Returns a success result if the Corona runtime was able to start up.
Returns a failure result if unable to start. In this case, the result object's "Message" property will provide an error message indicating why the failure occurred.

summary.para: Starts the Corona runtime using the given launch settings.
If the runtime is currently executing a Corona project, then it will be terminated before running a new one.

param.name: settings
param.para: Settings which allow you to customize the Corona runtime environment such as directory paths, which file to launch on startup.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

returns.para: Returns a success result if the Corona runtime was able to start up.
Returns a failure result if unable to start. In this case, the result object's "Message" property will provide an error message indicating why the failure occurred.

member.name: E:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntime.Started
member.summary: Raised just after the "main.lua" file has been executed by the Corona runtime.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntime.State
member.summary: Indicates if the Corona runtime is currently running, suspended, terminated, etc.

summary.para: Suspends/pauses the runtime, if currently running.
This will raise an "applicationSuspend" system event in Lua.
Raised when the Corona runtime has been suspended which pauses all rendering, audio, timers and other Corona related operations.
This is typically raised when the end-user navigates to another app or when the power button has been pressed.
Exits and destroys the runtime, if not done already.
This will raise an "applicationExit" system event in Lua.
Raised just before the Corona runtime environment is about to be terminated.
This typically happens when the end-user backs out of the app, the Corona XAML control has been unloaded from the page, or when the runtime's Terminate() method has been called.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: Provides information and services for one active Corona runtime instance.

summary.para: Subscribes an event handler to be invoked when the given Corona event name gets dispatched.
It is okay to call this method before the runtime has started. Once started, the runtime will automatically subscribe the given handler to the event.

param.name: eventName
param.para: The name of the event to subscribe to such as "system", "enterFrame", etc.
You can also specify your own custom event name that you can dispatch in Lua via Runtime:dispatchEvent() or via this object's method.
The given event name cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

param.name: eventHandler
param.para: The handler to be invoked when the Corona event has been dispatched/raised.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

summary.para: Gets the path that Corona's "system.CachesDirectory" property maps to in Lua.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.CoronaControlAdapter
member.summary: Gets the control that hosts the rendering surface and child controls created via Lua's native APIs.

summary.para: Gets the default path that Corona will use for the "system.CachesDirectory" property in Lua.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.DefaultDocumentsDirectoryPath
member.summary: Gets the default path that Corona will use for the "system.DocumentsDirectory" property in Lua.

summary.para: Gets the default path that Corona will use to store files for its internal features, such as analytics.
This directory is not made available in Lua.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.DefaultResourceDirectoryPath
member.summary: Gets the default path that Corona will use for the "system.ResourceDirectory" property in Lua.

summary.para: Gets the default path that Corona will use for the "system.TemporaryDirectory" property in Lua.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.
Dispatches the given Corona event to Lua to be received by a Lua function.
Lua functions can subscribe to the given event via the Lua Runtime:addEventListener() function.

param.name: eventArgs
param.para: The Corona event to be dispatched to Lua. Its properties will be passed into Lua as an "event" table.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

returns.para: Returns the result of this Corona event dispatch operation.

Will return a success result if the given Corona event was dispatched to Lua. The result object will also provide the value returned by a Lua event listener function (if any) via its "ReturnedValue" property. Note that a success result does not mean that there were any Lua event listeners subscribed to the given event via the Lua Runtime:addEventListener() function.
Will return a failure result if the Corona runtime has not been started up yet or if the runtime has been terminated. This means that there is no Lua state object available to push the event into.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.DocumentsDirectoryPath
member.summary: Gets the path that Corona's "system.DocumentsDirectory" property maps to in Lua.

summary.para: Gets the directory path that Corona uses to store files for its internal features, such as analytics.
This directory is not made available in Lua.
Provides cross-platform and cross-language access to features to the C/C++ side of Corona.
This property is not intended for public use.
Gets the path to the file that the Corona runtime began execution on.
Typically set to a "resource.car" "main.lua" or "resource.car" file.
Unsubscribes the given event handler from the specified Corona event.
This method is expected to be called with the same event name and handler arguments passed into the method.

param.name: eventName
param.para: The name of the Corona event to unsubscribe from such as "system", "enterFrame", etc.
The given event name cannot be null/empty or else an exception will be thrown.

param.name: eventHandler
param.para: Reference to the handler that was previously given to the method.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

returns.para: Returns true if the event handler was successfully unsubscribed from the Corona event.
Returns false if the given event handler reference was not previously subscribed to the given event name.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.ResourceDirectoryPath
member.summary: Gets the path that Corona's "system.ResourceDirectory" property maps to in Lua.

member.name: E:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.Resumed
member.summary: Raised when the Corona runtime has been resumed after a suspend.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment.RuntimeState
member.summary: Gets the current state of the Corona runtime such as Running, Suspended, Terminated, etc.

summary.para: Raised when the Corona runtime has been suspended which pauses all rendering, audio, timers and other Corona related operations.
This is typically raised when the end-user navigates to another app or when the power button has been pressed.
Gets the path that Corona's "system.TemporaryDirectory" property maps to in Lua.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.
Raised just before the Corona runtime environment is about to be terminated.
This typically happens when the end-user backs out of the app, the Corona XAML control has been unloaded from the page, or when the runtime's Terminate() method has been called.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEventArgs
member.summary: Provides information about a Corona runtime event.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEventArgs.#ctor(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment)
member.summary: Creates a new object for storing a Corona runtime event's information.

param.name: environment
param.para: The Corona runtime environment the event originated from.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeEventArgs.CoronaRuntimeEnvironment
member.summary: Gets the Corona runtime environment that the event originated from.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeLaunchSettings
member.summary: Provides customizable settings that Corona should use on startup, such as directory paths to be used in Lua and the Lua file to be executed on startup.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeLaunchSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new settings object initialized to its defaults.

summary.para: Gets or sets the path Corona will use for its caches directory.
This is the directory that Lua property "system.CachesDirectory" maps to.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeLaunchSettings.CopyFrom(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeLaunchSettings)
member.summary: Copies the given settings to this object.

param.name: settings
param.para: Reference to the settings object to copy from.
Will be ignored if set to null.

summary.para: Gets or sets the path Corona will use for its documents directory.
This is the directory that Lua property "system.DocumentsDirectory" maps to.
Gets or sets the directory path Corona will use for its internal features, such as analytics.
This directory is not made available in Lua.
Gets or set a path to the file that the Corona runtime will begin execution on.
Expected to be set to the path to a "main.lua" or "resource.car" file.
Gets or sets the path Corona will use for its resource directory.
This is the directory that Lua property "system.ResourceDirectory" maps to.
By default, this is set to the application's read-only ".\Assets\Corona" directory.
The caller can change this to a writable Application Data directory, which is useful if the Corona project files were downloaded.
Gets or sets the path Corona will use for its temporary directory.
This is the directory that Lua property "system.TemporaryDirectory" maps to.
This directory's files will be automatically deleted if the system is running low on storage space.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeState
member.summary: Indicates the current state of a CoronaRuntime object such as Starting, Running, etc.

member.name: F:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeState.NotStarted
member.summary: Indicates that the Corona runtime has not started a project yet.

summary.para: Indicates that the Corona runtime's Run() method has been called, but hasn't been started yet.
During this phase, the Corona runtime is initializing itself and attempting to access its rendering surface.

member.name: F:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeState.Running
member.summary: Indicates that the Corona runtime has been started/resumed and is actively executing its Lua scripts, rendering to the screen, playing audio, etc.

summary.para: Indicates that the Corona runtime's Suspend() method has been called and is in the middle of suspending itself.
During this phase, system event "applicationSuspend" is raised in Lua.
Indicates that the Corona runtime has been suspended.
This means features such as rendering, audio, timers, and other Corona related operations have been currently paused.
Indicates that the Corona runtime's Resume() method has been called and is in the middle of resuming itself.
During this phase, system event "applicationResume" event is raised in Lua.
Indicates that the Corona runtime is being terminated.
During this phase, system event "applicationExit" is raised in Lua.

member.name: F:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaRuntimeState.Terminated
member.summary: Indicates that the Corona runtime has been completely terminated.

summary.para: Indicates if the Corona runtime has succeeded in dispatching a Corona event to/from Lua.
Provides the result returned by Corona event handler/listener if dispatched successfully.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.FailedWith(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new result object set to failed and with the given message.
member.param: Message explaining why the operation failed. Can be null or empty.
member.returns: Returns a new result object set to failed and with the given message.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.HasFailed
member.summary: Determines if the operation failed.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.HasSucceeded
member.summary: Determines if the operation succeeded.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.Message
member.summary: Message providing details about the final result of the operation.
member.returns: Returns a message providing details about the final result of the operation. If the operation failed, then this message typically provides details indicating what went wrong. Operations that are successful typically provide an empty message string.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.ReturnedValue
member.summary: Provides the value returned by the Corona event handler/listener.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.DispatchCoronaLuaEventResult.SucceededWith(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedData)
member.summary: Creates a new result set to succeeded and with the given return value.
member.param: The value returned by the Corona event handler. Can be null.
member.returns: Returns a new result object set to succeeded and with the given return value.

summary.para: Object which stores a single value that can be transferred to/from Lua.
Can perform Equals() and CompareTo() checks with other comparable objects and can be used as a key in a table.
Instances of this interface are immutable and can be used as a key in a hash table or dictionary.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedComparableData.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this object is less than, greater than, or equal to the given object.
member.param: The object to be compared with.

returns.para: Returns a positive value if this object is greater than the given object.
Returns a negative value if this object is less than the given object.
Returns zero if the both objects are equal.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedComparableData.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this object matches the given object.
member.param: The object to compare with.

returns.para: Returns true if the given object's value matches this object's value.
Returns false if they do not equal, if given null, or if the given object is of a different type.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedComparableData.GetHashCode
member.summary: Gets an integer hash code for this object.
member.returns: Returns this object's hash code.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedData
member.summary: Stores data that can be transferred to/from Lua.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ICoronaBoxedData.PushToLua(System.Int64)
member.summary: Pushes this object's data to the top of the Lua stack.
member.param: Memory address to a lua_State object, convertible to a C/C++ pointer.

returns.para: Returns true if the push was successful.
Returns false if it failed or if given a memory address of zero (aka: null pointer).

summary.para: Wraps an existing object, providing read-only access to the collection's properties.
Note that this read-only collection cannot prevent modifications of mutables property values.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ReadOnlyCoronaLuaEventProperties.#ctor(CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.CoronaLuaEventProperties)
member.summary: Creates a new read-only wrapper around the given mutable properties collection.

param.name: properties
param.para: The property collection to be wrapped by the new read-only wrapper.
Cannot be null or else an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ReadOnlyCoronaLuaEventProperties.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the given property name exists in the collection.
member.param: The unique name of the property to search for.

returns.para: Returns true if the given property name exists in the collection.
Returns false if not or if given a null/emptry string.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ReadOnlyCoronaLuaEventProperties.Count
member.summary: Fetches the number of properties stored in the collection.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ReadOnlyCoronaLuaEventProperties.First
member.summary: Gets an iterator that can be used to traverse all properties in the collection via a foreach loop.
member.returns: Returns an iterator that can be used to traverse all properties in the collection.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.Corona.WinRT.ReadOnlyCoronaLuaEventProperties.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches a property value from the collection by its property name.
member.param: The unique name of the property to fetch from.

returns.para: Returns the value of the specified property in boxed object form.
Returns null if the property name was not found.

member.name: T:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String
member.summary: Represents a UTF-8 encoded string.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an empty string.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new UTF-8 encoded string using the given UTF-16 encoded string.
member.param: Reference to a UTF-16 encoded string. Can be null or empty.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.ByteCount
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes used to store this UTF-8 encoded string, including the null termination character.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.CharacterCount
member.summary: Gets the number of characters in this string, excluding the null termination character.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.Empty
member.summary: Represents an empty "" UTF-8 encoded string.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.Equals(CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String)
member.summary: Determines if the given string matches this string.
member.param: The string to be compared with.

returns.para: Returns true if the given string matches this string.
Returns false if they do no match or if the given string is null.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if this object matches the given object.
member.param: The object to compare with.

returns.para: Returns true if the given object's value matches this object's value.
Returns false if they do not equal, if given null, or if the given object is of a different type.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.From(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the given UTF-16 string to a UTF-8 encoded string object.
member.param: The UTF-16 string to be converted. Can be null or empty.

returns.para: Returns an object containing the UTF-8 equivlanet of the given UTF-16 string.
Returns an empty string if the given string is null or empty.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.IsEmpty
member.summary: Determines if this string does not contain any characters.

member.name: P:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.IsNotEmpty
member.summary: Determines if this string contains any characters.

member.name: M:CoronaLabs.WinRT.Utf8String.ToString
member.summary: Converts this UTF-8 encoded string to a UTF-16 encoded standard string object.
member.returns: Returns this string converted to UTF-16 form.
